attributes.action: Ban the use of trolleys in supermarkets to ensure everyone gets what they need
attributes.additional_details: Things are getting out of control and the government are doing what they can. There are so many of us wit growing concern for elderly and NHS workers that are having to go without due to unnecessary panic buying. We need stronger measures.
attributes.background: We are a great nation, but we are crumbling with people panic buying and stealing from those in need when there is enough tk go around. Please vote for baskets ONLY to be permitted in supermarkets so people just get what they need and everyone can eat.

rejection.details:
This would be a decision for individual retailers, not the UK Government or Parliament. In any case, it could prevent people with disabilities, or frail and elderly people from being able to access groceries.

You may like to sign this petition on limiting purchases instead: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300766

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
